tb7.title: Divine Space Battle
tb7.desc:
This project was my first foray into fast-paced animation, re-enacting a battle from the Touhou Project.

Following a one-year hiatus from animation, I used this project to completely re-evaluate my workflow. A major breakthrough was introducing a dedicated 'pre-production' phase, which utilizing blocking and animatics. It was instrumental in smoothing out the pacing. Additionally, because the choreography is original, I leaned heavily on a wider range of references for inspiration and movement logic.

On the technical side, I studied cinematography techniques to enhance the sense of motion, specifically focusing on shot composition and dynamic camera work. I also placed a much heavier emphasis on post-production, utilizing VFX and layered SFX to heighten the intensity of the combat.

tb5.title: Rin's Solo Camp
tb5.desc:
For this project, I focused on creating a calming environment, reminiscent of Yuru Camp's signature aesthetic.

Key elements included a slow-paced narrative and a cool color palette, designed to evoke the same sense of tranquility found in the anime.

Technically, I incorporated cloth simulations to add realism to Rin's scarf and hand-painted the background mountains to achieve a 'painterly' look.

tb3.title: kessoku band -『忘れてやらない guitarhero COVER』
tb3.desc:
The focus for this project was on precision and attention to fine details since its an accurate recreation of a guitar performance. Each movement had to be frame-perfect to the audio beats.

Since I don't play the guitar personally, I asked many guitar-playing friends how they would approach certain sections, which helped refine hand positions and overall body movement.

Technically, I had to be comfortable with creating custom rig adjustments and using inverse kinematics (IK).

tb1.title: Happy Birthday.
tb1.desc:
For this project, I took my first step into formal storyboarding and creating an original narrative.

I wanted to build a short film centered around a specific in-game item, leaning into a subtle dark tone that was naturally enhanced by Lethal Company's gritty, industrial aesthetic.

Beyond the story, I began to develop my own animation workflow and experimented with light video editing to enhance the storytelling.

tb2.title: GEO STATE
tb2.desc:
This project marked my first transition from short clips to a full-length scene, using Genshin Impact characters to interpret an iconic sequence from Breaking Bad.

It was through the process of synchronizing dialogue with intricate facial expressions and gestures that I discovered my passion for specializing in character-driven work.

This project was vital to my creative development as I dipped into several aspects of the 3D pipeline, including lighting and rendering.
